---
title: 'Postman Collection'
search_results: 'Global Payments - Your Integration'
subtitle: 'Use Postman for easier integration with our API'
tag: 'rest'
created: '06/08/2024'
---
Our API Postman collection is available to view, fork, or import (a copy). It includes API requests and responses for many of our products, including Transaction Processing, Fraud Management, Settlement Reporting, Dispute Management, and more. You’ll also find practical use cases for both card-present and card-not-present scenarios, including 3D Secure, Transactions, Card Storage, Refunds, and more. 

To get right to it, skip to the [Run in Postman](#run-in-postman) section.

If you're not familiar with Postman, see the [Get Postman](#get-postman) section.

## How to use it
If you’re new to our API, we recommend you first read our documentation to get familiar with how things work. For an overview of our learning resources for this developer portal, see [Build Your Integration](/docs/getting-started/your-integration).

Once you’re ready, we ask that you fork the collection. The collection comes with a working test app in the environment file that can serve as your test credentials. However, we highly recommend that you register with us and get your own test app credentials (for more information, see [Register / Create an App](/docs/getting-started/register)). To start using the API, replace the credentials in the environment file of our Postman collection with your own.

## Use cases
The collection contains practical use cases you can implement using our REST API. The below example shows our 3D Secure use cases.

<img alt="File tree structure in Postman showing use cases for 3D Secure." src="/gh-assets/postman_use-cases.png" width="325" height="225" style={{display: "block", margin: "0 auto"}} />

<p style={{textAlign: "center"}}>**3DS Use Cases in Postman**</p>

## Keep it updated
The collection is updated periodically, so keep checking back. Keep in mind that you'll need to import the collection again when a new version of the API is released to get any new updates.

## Run in Postman
To view, import, or fork our API collection in Postman, click the button below:

<Tabs active="merchants">  
<Tab id="merchants" title="Merchants">
    <Infobox type="danger">
        The below link is for merchant processing. If you are looking for partner functionality, please click the appropriate tab above.
    </Infobox>

    <div className="postman-run-button" data-postman-action="collection/fork" data-postman-collection-url="entityId=15261149-a194b7f0-81f4-4b60-9259-f7258fb42092&amp;entityType=collection&amp;workspaceId=a25789c4-2d5d-46d4-8dd5-9a18a0154473" data-postman-param="env%5BUnified%20Payments%20Platform%20API%20(GP-API)%20Environment%" data-postman-var-1="15261149-a194b7f0-81f4-4b60-9259-f7258fb42092" data-postman-visibility="public">&nbsp;</div>
   </Tab>

        The below link is for partner processing. If you are looking for merchant only functionality, please click the appropriate tab above.

</Tabs>

## Get Postman
If you’re not currently using Postman, you can [create a free account](https://identity.getpostman.com/login) and give it a try. It's a simple collaborative platform with an extensive range of features to help you interact more seamlessly with our API. Postman can be run in a web browser (Chrome, Firefox, and Edge), Microsoft Windows (v4.4.3 or higher), or in the [Postman app](https://www.postman.com/downloads).

## Next steps
Once you’ve thoroughly tested your integration in our Sandbox, it’s time to [go live](/docs/getting-started/going-to-production) and take payments for real.
